Article_Name: Iconic Bengal Singer Sandhya Mukherjee Cremated With Full State Honours
News Info: Thousands lined up on the road on Wednesday and her evergreen Bengali songs were played over the public address system as the body of legendary singer Sandhya Mukherjee was taken on its last journey.

Article_Name: Ratan Tata Honoured With Assam's Highest Civilian Award
News Info: Tata Trusts Chairman Ratan Tata has been honoured with the Assam Baibhav, the state's highest civilian award.

Article_Name: "Only 5 things Essential In Islam, Hijab Not Among Them": Kerala Governor
News Info: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan today said the ongoing row over hijab is "not a controversy but a conspiracy" to push back Muslim women.  "There is no conflict between religion and education," he said.

Article_Name: "Problem Is Your Hyperbole...": Supreme Court On One Rank One Pension
News Info: The centre's "hyperbole" on the One Rank, One Pension policy "presents a much rosier picture" than what is actually given to military pensioners, the Supreme Court said today while hearing a petition by former servicemen.

Article_Name: Tatas Will Make Air India Financially Fit, Bring In New Fleet: Chairman
News Info: Tata group will make Air India financially fit, upgrade aircraft, bring in new fleet and make it the most technologically advanced airline globally, Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran said on Wednesday.

Article_Name: "Ukraine Invasion Threat Real": US Sees No Meaningful Pullback By Russia
News Info: Secretary of State Antony Blinken said Wednesday that the United States had seen no evidence of a significant Russian withdrawal of its military forces from Ukraine's borders, despite Moscow's claim.

Article_Name: Sleep Apnea Which Caused Bappi Lahiri's Death A Serious Disorder: Experts
News Info: Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA), a common but serious sleep-related breathing disorder, can affect people of all ages, including infants and young children, experts said on Wednesday.

Article_Name: 255 New Covid Cases In Mumbai, No Death Recorded For 2nd Day In A Row
News Info: Mumbai did not record any death linked to COVID-19 for the second consecutive day on Wednesday, while 255 people tested positive for the infection, the civic body said.

Article_Name: Energy Requirements Of Indians Expected To Double In 20 Years: PM
News Info: Energy requirements of the people of India are expected to double in the next 20 years, Prime Minister Narendra Modi said on Wednesday as he urged developed countries to fulfil their commitments on finance and technology transfer.

Article_Name: Will Second Wife Get Dead Husband's Pension? High Court Says This
News Info: The Bombay High Court on Wednesday said that a second wife is not entitled to receive her dead husband's pension in cases where the second marriage had taken place without legal dissolution of the first one.

Article_Name: Gurgaon Housing Society Built By State-Owned Firm Declared Unsafe
News Info: A housing society with over 700 flats in Gurgaon, constructed by the state-owned NBCC (India) Ltd, will be demolished after it was declared unsafe for habitation.

Article_Name: 6 Women Killed As SUV Hits Road Divider In Chhattisgarh, 5 Injured
News Info: Six women were killed and five others, including a driver, injured after the SUV they were travelling in crashed into a road divider on a national highway in Raipur district of Chhattisgarh on Wednesday morning, police said.

Article_Name: Meghalaya Chief Minister Discusses Armed Group's Peace Plan With Centre
News Info: Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad K Sangma today met with Union Home Secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla in Delhi and discussed a peace proposal by the insurgent group Hynniewtrep National Liberation Council, or HNLC.

Article_Name: Kiran Shaw, Mohandas Pai Spar Over Yogi's Role In India's Top Exchange Case
News Info: An unknown Himalayan yogi's influence on Chitra Ramkrishna during her stint as NSE chief few years ago has triggered heated exchanges on social media between former NSE board member TV Mohandas Pai and Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-S

Article_Name: Assam, Meghalaya Have Agreed To Resolve Border Disputes In 6 Places: Conrad Sangma
News Info: Assam and Meghalaya have agreed to resolve their boundary disputes in six locations and are ready to find solutions to six other such areas soon, Meghalaya Chief Minister Conrad Sangma said on Wednesday.
